notesStmt.note: Defective at the beginning and at the end. Lacuna of 12 leaves after folio 412. Folio 412 much mutilated. Slightly stained.
Folio 1 contains a fragment on עריות belonging to another Sefer mitsṿot.A fragment of the list of mitsṿot lo taʿaseh is prefixed.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: The second part of the Sefer mitsṿot gadol of Moses ben Jacob of Coucy.

msItem.title: Sefer mitsṿot gadol ספר מצות גדול

collation.p: 52 quires of mostly 8 leaves each. Imperfect at the beginning and at the end. Lacuna after folio 412. Quires marked with Hebrew letters and Roman figures in reverse order at the end.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Oriental semi-cursive script, unpunctuated, of 14th century.

binding.p: BM/BL in-house. Spine title: 'Moses of Coucy. Sepher Mitsvoth Gadol. Hebrew. Brit. Mus. Additional 27, 040.'

history.provenance: Acquisition: Giuseppe Almanzi (b. 1801, d. 1860), bibliophile; his manuscript no. 146; his library including 322 medieval Hebrew manuscripts were purchased en bloc by the British Museum in October 1865 for £1,000 through Asher & Co., Berlin bookseller and dealer to the British Museum (see 131-153): inscribed, folio [416v].
